titles.title: A bill to designate September 17 of every year as "Constitution Day" and to establish such day as a legal holiday with certain limitations.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Judiciary.

bill.summary: 2/26/1987--Introduced. Establishes September 17 as a legal public holiday called Constitution Day. Excludes Constitution Day from being treated as a legal public holiday for purposes of statutes relating to pay and leave of employees.
